name: A Kingdom Kidnapped
description:
Story

You are a king of a distant, fictional land who wakes up one morning to find that everyone has disappeared. Your family, guards, citizens, even the citizens’ pets. You exit the castle to find a note that reveals that a soldier you had imprisoned many years ago has been holding a grudge against you for all those years and learned dark magic to make you pay for what you had done. He finally escaped and cast a spell on the entire kingdom leaving you to come rescue them yourself. I mean what is a king without his subjects?

Assets used:
  • Fantasy Tileset by OddPotatoGift
  • Extra Set of Fantasy Tiles by OddPotatoGift
  • Forest Background by edermunizz
  • Starry Sky Background by OddPotatoGift
  • Tileset Used as Background for a Level by ansimuz
  • Main Character Tilesheet by rvros 
  • Slimer Tilesheet by rvros
  • Boneman Tilesheet by Jesse Munguia
  • Skull Tilesheet by unTied Games
  • Collectables by La Red Games
  • Collectables by OddPotatoGift
  • Portal Tilesheet by Elthen's Pixel Art Shop
  • Font Used by Astramat

(If I used your assets in this game and didn't credit you, let me know so I can add it to this list)

Notes

There are only two working levels in this game so far and your progress is only saved after you use the door at the end of each level to pass to the next one.

The ml-agents package was used to teach the floating skull enemies how to navigate the space and how to attack (it's not perfect yet so sometimes it works very well, sometimes not well at all).

(This was an undergraduate capstone project for a BS in Computer Science in 2019)
